data.title: The 30+ Best NBA Miami Heat Small Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 30+ Best NBA Miami Heat Small Forwards. Current Top 3: LeBron James, Jimmy Butler, Glen Rice
data.text:
Ranked By

792 votes

216 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Miami Heat

Big fan of Miami basketball? Then check out this list of Miami Heat small forwards with photos and seasons played with the team. It includes almost every small forward from throughout Miami Heat history, including current small forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA small forwards of all time, the best Heat SFs include LeBron James, Glen Rice, Jamal Mashburn, and Eddie Jones.

In the 2017-18 NBA season, the current Miami Heat starting SFs and backup SFs are Josh Richardson, Justise Winslow, Okaro White, and Rodney McGruder.

Who are the best small forwards in Miami Heat history? Here is every player who has ever held the position of Miami Heat small forward.

Most divisive: Jim Jackson

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 30+ Best NBA Miami Heat Small Forwards

Birthplace : Akron, Ohio, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Power forward

Heat Seasons: 2011-2014

Coming to the Miami Heat in 2010 through a sign-and-trade deal, LeBron James established himself as one of the greatest small forwards to ever don the team's jersey. Known for his incredible athleticism and versatility, James led the Heat to four consecutive NBA Finals appearances from 2011 to 2014, winning two championships in 2012 and 2013. During his time in Miami, he earned two MVP awards (2012 and 2013) and two Finals MVP awards (2012 and 2013), solidifying his place among the franchise's all-time greats.

Birthplace : Houston, Texas

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Miami Heat

Position : Small forward

Heat Seasons: 2019-2022

Joining the Miami Heat in 2019 as part of a four-team trade, Jimmy Butler immediately emerged as a true leader and fan favorite due to his relentless work ethic and penchant for clutch performances. A skilled scorer and tenacious defender, Butler was instrumental in guiding the Heat to the 2020 NBA Finals, where they narrowly lost to the Los Angeles Lakers. In just a short time with the franchise, he has earned multiple All-Star selections, setting the stage for a long and illustrious tenure in South Florida.

Birthplace : Jacksonville, Arkansas

Nationality : American

Team : Los Angeles Lakers, Miami Heat, Charlotte Hornets, New York Knicks, Houston Rockets

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Heat Seasons: 1990-1995

Drafted by the Miami Heat in 1989, Glen Rice quickly became the franchise's premier scoring threat and a dominant small forward in the league. Known for his smooth shooting touch, Rice made a significant impact during his time with the Heat, earning an All-Star selection in 1995. As one of the most prolific scorers in franchise history, Rice's impressive offensive repertoire continues to leave a lasting legacy in Miami.

Birthplace : Birmingham, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Miami Heat

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Heat Seasons: 2011-2014

Joining the Miami Heat as a free agent in 2011, Shane Battier proved to be the quintessential "glue guy," providing the team with lockdown defense, energy, and timely three-point shooting. With his high basketball IQ and impressive work ethic, Battier played an instrumental role in helping the Heat secure back-to-back championships in 2012 and 2013. His selfless play and dedication to the team continue to serve as a shining example of what it means to be a true professional in the NBA.

Birthplace : Racine, Wisconsin

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Los Angeles Clippers

Position : Small forward

Heat Seasons: 2003-2004

Drafted by the Miami Heat in 2002, Caron Butler showcased his scoring prowess and natural athleticism from the moment he stepped onto the hardwood. Though his stint with the team was short-lived, Butler impressed fans and coaches alike with his ability to create and finish at the rim, earning All-Rookie First Team honors during his debut season. Although he never reached his full potential in Miami, Butler's exciting playstyle and immense talent remain ingrained in franchise history.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Nationality : American

Position : Small forward

Heat Seasons: 1997-2000

Traded to the Heat in 1997, Jamal Mashburn brought his versatile scoring ability and innate court vision to the team. As a key part of the Miami's late-'90s success, Mashburn earned an All-Star selection in 1998 and cemented himself as one of the franchise's most dynamic offensive weapons. His time with the Heat may have been marked by frequent injury, but his skill and dedication to the game continue to resonate with fans today.
